Macron faces risk of destabilized presidency as PM Bayrou expected to fall
subhead: The French president has ruled out resigning or dissolving the Assemblée Nationale, the latter of which some in his camp see as inevitable. Mounting opposition pressure, the specter of a major social movement and the need to pass the budget before December 31 are forcing him to act quickly.

Palestinian leader Abbas barred from UN summit, says US official
subhead: Palestinian Authority President Mahmoud Abbas is among 80 officials being denied visas by the US to attend next month's UN General Assembly in New York.

title: From Meta AI to ChatGPT: The dangerous game of ever-increasing AI personalization
subhead: While publicly pledging to design safe tools, Meta and OpenAI continue to give users the ability to steer their chatbots away from relative neutrality. Is this paradox sustainable in the long term?

title: In Hawaii, the repentant volcano: 'I see it as a metaphor for the misuse of our planet's resources'
subhead: 'Of Volcanoes and Men' (3/6). In Hawaii, there is a local belief that the goddess Pele brings misfortune to careless visitors who dare to take a piece of volcanic earth with them. To ward off this 'curse,' many return their stolen souvenirs along with a note of apology. Photographer Ryan Thompson has compiled these testimonies of repentance.

title: Mohammed Hilles' first days in France after arriving from Gaza: 'I went to a baroque concert at the Philharmonie. It filled me with joy, sadness and nostalgia'
subhead: Hilles, 25, left Gaza to study music at Paris-Saclay University. After the initial relief of his arrival, he has grown increasingly worried about his family in the Palestinian enclave.

Mohammed VI, Islam and the Islamists
subhead: 'The Enigma of Mohammed VI' (6/6). His status as 'commander of the faithful' has given the Moroccan king a unique aura and has enabled him to push back against the ambitions of Islamists, whose political project and way of life he rejects.
byline: By Christophe Ayad and Frédéric Bobin

title: Is France's debt situation as worrying as PM François Bayrou claims?
subhead: The French prime minister justifies the €44 billion in budgetary efforts he is demanding for 2026 by citing the worrying state of public finances. But is the situation really that dire?
byline: By Romain Imbach and  Léa Prati

title: Ultra-processed foods cause negative health effects within weeks, study finds
subhead: In a clinical trial similar to those used for testing medicines, scientists studied the health impacts of a diet filled with ultra-processed foods. Results show that numerous biological processes are affected.
